definition: to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days

sentences.english: I am at your command, Mr. District-Attorney.
sentences.chinese: 检察官先生，我静候您的处理。

sentences.english: A female lion squatted in the shrub, waiting for her games.
sentences.chinese: 一只母狮蜷伏在灌木丛中，静候着她的猎物。

sentences.english: “God, ” he said, and waited for the laugh.
sentences.chinese: “上帝啊，”他自语，静候“笑声”的出现。

sentences.english: And we wait, on each bank of the Milky Way, for that single day to come.
sentences.chinese: 我们静候着，在银河两畔，等待着那一天的到来。

sentences.english: We are waiting for their closer information.
sentences.chinese: 我们在静候他们进一步的消息。

sentences.english: I have been waiting for more than three years to write this column.
sentences.chinese: 三年多来我一直静候时机能写这么个专栏。

sentences.english: I heard a clear music" autumn", with eyes closed for autumn Pro falls.
sentences.chinese: 我听一曲清清音乐《秋》，闭眼静候深秋的临落。

sentences.english: Yet quietly my captain awaits my silence.
sentences.chinese: 但我的船长还在静候着我的沉寂。

definition: to look forward to sth/to wait respectfully
to wait for/to expect/to keep watch/to watch over/to nurse
to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
to raise one's head and look
variant of 少安毋躁[shao3 an1 wu2 zao4]
everything in its place and ready (idiom)
to be late/to arrive slowly/to be slow in the coming
to wait for action after having accumulated power, energy etc
to hold back one's troops without moving (idiom); to bide one's time
to get ready (for a journey)/ready and waiting
